thread.title: Another Moto G5 Plus live image leaked, this time of the back panel
thread.title_full: Another Moto G5 Plus live image leaked, this time of the back panel

title: Another Moto G5 Plus live image leaked, this time of the back panel
text:
Another Moto G5 Plus live image leaked, this time of the back... Another Moto G5 Plus live image leaked, this time of the back panel By - February 10, 2017 “The Moto G5 Plus will offer a 5.2-inch FHD display, an octa-core SoC, a 12MP rear camera and Nougat” 
Earlier this month, an alleged live image of the Moto G5 Plus, showing its front panel, hit the interwebs. Now another live image of the phone has been leaked ahead of the expected unveiling later this month. The new image shows the back of the device with an unconventional primary camera setup. 
As seen in the image, the Moto G5 Plus will flaunt an all-metal unibody design. The Moto branding is placed in the midde of the back panel. The camera setup appears to have a laser autofocus sensor and a dual-LED flash. As per the earlier reports, the phone will get a 12MP Rapid Focus camera with a Sony IMX362 sensor and 4K recording. 
As per the reports, the Moto G5 Plus will feature a 5.2-inch full HD display, and will be powered by a 2.0GHz octa-core processor. It will offer a 3,000mAh battery with fast charging support, a fingerprint sensor, NFC and Android Nougat with Motorola Experiences. The phone is expected to be unveiled at Lenovo’s pre-MWC event on February 26th.
